item.title: Practical Uses for Flexbox
item.description: If you’ve been developing for the web in the past couple of years, you have most likely heard of CSS’s Flexbox layout module (also known as flexbox). Maybe you’ve used it, or maybe you’ve shied away from it in favor of more familiar layout methods. I’ve been using flexbox fairly regularly for the past few months and I have to say, it’s pretty amazing. Here are some practical uses that I have found.

item.title: Using CSS Masks to Create “Transparent” JPGs
item.description: JPG images are great. They allow us to show photos on the web while keeping the file size relatively small (compared to a photo saved as a PNG, anyway). But what do you do when you need a photo with transparency and you don’t want to sacrifice file size? Enter CSS masks.

item.title: Apple CarPlay: First Impressions
item.description: A little over a week ago, I got a new car which came equipped with Apple CarPlay. If you’re not familiar with CarPlay, it’s essentially a platform that allows you to replace your car’s built-in user interface with an interface that runs off your iPhone. I’ve spent some time with it and wanted to share some of my initial thoughts.

item.title: An App to Keep Our Blog on Track
item.description: I had a bit of downtime at work, so I used Firebase to create an app to keep track of our team blog schedule.
